tool.name: SAGA.grid_spline.8
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPOINTS False isArrayZ_FIELD False isArrayV_FIELD False isArrayTARGET_TEMPLATE False output_data_GRIDS $output_data_GRIDS name SAGA.grid_spline.8 POINTS $POINTS Z_FIELD $Z_FIELD Z_SCALE $Z_SCALE V_FIELD $V_FIELD TARGET_DEFINITION $TARGET_DEFINITION TARGET_USER_SIZE $TARGET_USER_SIZE TARGET_USER_XMIN $TARGET_USER_XMIN TARGET_USER_XMAX $TARGET_USER_XMAX TARGET_USER_YMIN $TARGET_USER_YMIN TARGET_USER_YMAX $TARGET_USER_YMAX TARGET_USER_COLS $TARGET_USER_COLS TARGET_USER_ROWS $TARGET_USER_ROWS TARGET_USER_FITS $TARGET_USER_FITS TARGET_TEMPLATE $TARGET_TEMPLATE TARGET_USER_ZSIZE $TARGET_USER_ZSIZE TARGET_USER_ZMIN $TARGET_USER_ZMIN TARGET_USER_ZMAX $TARGET_USER_ZMAX TARGET_USER_ZNUM $TARGET_USER_ZNUM EPSILON $EPSILON LEVEL_MAX $LEVEL_MAX prefer $prefer response $response outputType_GRIDS $OutputSection_GRIDS.outputType_GRIDS transmissionMode_GRIDS $OutputSection_GRIDS.transmissionMode_GRIDS

param.name: POINTS
param.label: Points
param.help: Points The following data types are allowed in the txt file: json, xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml

param.name: Z_FIELD
param.label: Z
param.help: Z The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: V_FIELD
param.label: Value
param.help: Value The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: TARGET_USER_COLS
param.label: Columns
param.help: Number of cells in East-West direction.

param.name: TARGET_USER_ROWS
param.label: Rows
param.help: Number of cells in North-South direction.

param.name: TARGET_TEMPLATE
param.label: Target System
param.help: use this grid's system for output grids The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff, png

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_GRIDS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: Multilevel B-spline algorithm for spatial interpolation of scattered data as proposed by Lee, Wolberg and Shin (1997) modified for 3D data.<br/>The algorithm makes use of a coarse-to-fine hierarchy of control lattices to generate a sequence of bicubic B-spline functions, whose sum approaches the desired interpolation function. Performance gains are realized by using B-spline refinement to reduce the sum of these functions into one equivalent B-spline function. <br/><br/>The 'Maximum Level' determines the maximum size of the final B-spline matrix and increases exponential with each level. Where level=10 requires about 1mb level=12 needs about 16mb and level=14 about 256mb(!) of additional memory.
